extracted_information: The web content outlines Microsoft's Inclusive Design methodology, principles, and provides a collection of tools and guidebooks. It defines Inclusive Design as a methodology born from digital environments that embraces human diversity, focusing on recognizing exclusion, learning from diversity, and solving for one to extend to many. While it offers extensive guidelines for inclusive design thinking and practice through various downloadable resources, it does not detail specific technical accessibility requirements or a formal design system's technical specifications for inclusive interfaces. The content emphasizes methodology and mindset over prescriptive technical standards.

specifications.accessibility_requirements: Specific technical accessibility requirements are not detailed in the provided content. The content focuses on design principles and methodologies that lead to accessible outcomes.
specifications.technical_requirements_inclusive_interfa: Specific technical requirements for inclusive interfaces (e.g., ARIA standards, color contrast ratios, keyboard navigation standards) are not explicitly listed or detailed in the provided content. The content emphasizes conceptual approaches and guides for inclusive design.

items.name: Recognize exclusion
items.description: Acknowledge bias and recognize exclusions that happen because of mismatches between people and experience.

items.name: Learn from diversity
items.description: Inclusive Design puts people in the center throughout the process. Their fresh, diverse perspectives are key to true insight.

items.name: Solve for one, extend to many
items.description: Everyone has abilities and limits. Creating products for people with permanent disabilities creates results that benefit everyone.

items.name: Inclusive 101 Guidebook
items.description: Comprehensive introduction to inclusive design, shifting design thinking toward universal solutions.

items.name: Inclusive Design for Cognition Guidebook
items.description: Introduction to Inclusive Design for Cognition, focusing on building products that account for diverse human cognition.

items.name: In Pursuit of Inclusive AI
items.description: Primer on how bias affects artificial intelligence.

items.name: Inclusive Design for Mental Health Guidebook
items.description: Extends cognitive framework into mental health, respecting it in product experiences.

items.name: Inclusive Design for Mental Health cards
items.description: Design pattern cards providing guidance for specific design patterns.

items.name: Case Studies: Creating for Cognition
items.description: Curated selection of stories about reducing cognitive exclusion in products.

items.name: Inclusive Design for Cognition Screeners
items.description: Questions for recruiting co-creators aligned with cognitive areas and situational contexts.

items.name: Inclusive Design for Cognition Worksheet
items.description: Step-by-step process for integrating inclusive design for cognition methodology.

items.name: Respecting Focus
items.description: Guidance on adapting experiences to be considerate of interrupting customers.

items.name: Devices, Accessories, and Augmentations
items.description: Guidance on designing adjustable or augmented physical products for disabled individuals.

items.name: Creating for Guidance
items.description: Insight into how a product team integrated Inclusive Design into their work.

items.name: Inclusive activity cards
items.description: Activity and support cards to integrate into processes, for creative thinking and stress-testing concepts.

items.name: Creating Accessible Packaging
items.description: Covers principles, practices, and metrics for bringing inclusive design to product packaging.
